pageContent: Purpose: Erectile dysfunction is a common side effect in men treated for prostate cancer. Previously published studies document the incidence of erectile dysfunction in men treated for prostate cancer to be between 20% and 88%. To our knowledge a prospective evaluation focused on the development of erectile dysfunction in men treated for prostate cancer has not elucidated components of its chronology or risk factors.

metaData.source:
[Late effects following curative radiotherapy for prostate cancer]
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/16159460/
